page.title: 10New Forest-Felling Conifers1
page.content: The yield of conifers from the whole New Forest is approximately 35000 tons per annum. There are three types of product derived from the felling of conifers or softwood trees. 1.{Logs from 6-16 cms}diameter are sent to pulp mills. At present those in Sweden are being used as this is the most economical. The pulp is then returned to paper mills in the U.K. However this arrangement may change next year. 2.{Short logs from 16-30 cms}diameter are cut by the foresters to specified lengths and go to local mills to be made into planking, fencing material, chips (for all weather horse gallops) and carcassing. For example a mill at Cadnam makes up boxes which are filled with liquid latex at Fawley petrochemical industry and then sent to Japan. {Cont>
